title: Rainy Day Champions
tagline: All-weather adventures that love the rain
suitableFor: Families with children aged 7+, active couples, and anyone who enjoys a mix of adventure and indoor attractions, regardless of the weather. Comfortable for those with a reasonable level of fitness.
notSuitableFor: Those with severe mobility issues or a strong aversion to enclosed spaces may find some activities challenging. Very young children (under 7) may be restricted from some activities.

stops.title: Bounce Below
stops.description: Jump and explore giant trampolines suspended in a disused slate mine. A unique and exhilarating experience for all ages.

wetAlt.title: Llechwedd Deep Mine Tour
wetAlt.description: Descend deep into the Llechwedd slate mines for a fascinating historical tour.

budgetAlt.title: Llechwedd Quarry Trails Walk
budgetAlt.description: Explore the surface of the Llechwedd quarry with panoramic views of Blaenau Ffestiniog.

stops.title: Caffi Blaenau
stops.description: A friendly cafe in Blaenau Ffestiniog serving classic Welsh dishes and light lunches.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Llyn Ogwen
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own lunch beside the stunning Llyn Ogwen lake.

stops.title: Zip World Fforest Coaster
stops.description: A gravity-driven toboggan run through the beautiful Fforest woodland. Fun for all the family.

wetAlt.title: Tree Top Nets at Zip World Fforest
wetAlt.description: Bounce and explore the treetop nets, a covered outdoor activity.

budgetAlt.title: Swallow Falls Walk
budgetAlt.description: Visit the impressive Swallow Falls, a short walk from Betws-y-Coed (entrance fee applies, but worth it).

stops.title: Plas y Brenin
stops.description: National Mountaineering Centre providing comfortable rooms and a lively atmosphere, perfect for outdoor enthusiasts.

budgetAlt.title: Ben's Bunkhouse
budgetAlt.description: Budget-friendly bunkhouse accommodation in Nant Peris.

stops.title: The Heights Hotel
stops.description: A local pub in Llanberis with great views and family meals

budgetAlt.title: Local Chip Shop
budgetAlt.description: Grab a takeaway and eat by the lake

stops.title: Gorge Walking
stops.description: Experience the thrill of scrambling through a mountain gorge, jumping into pools, and navigating waterfalls (wetsuit provided).

wetAlt.title: National White Water Centre - Indoor Kayaking Session
wetAlt.description: Practice your kayaking skills in the safe environment of the Tryweryn river.

budgetAlt.title: Llyn Tegid Walk
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic walk around the shores of Llyn Tegid (Bala Lake).

stops.title: Bala Spice
stops.description: Popular Indian restaurant in Bala, offering a wide range of flavorful dishes.
stops.travelToNext: 1.5 hour drive via A494 and A5

budgetAlt.title: Packed Lunch at Bala Lake
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a picnic by the shores of the largest natural lake in Wales.

stops.title: Velocity 2 Zip Line
stops.description: Experience the fastest zip line in the world, flying over Penrhyn Quarry at speeds of over 100mph.

wetAlt.title: Zip World Slate Caverns
wetAlt.description: Explore the underground caverns via a series of zip lines and rope bridges.

budgetAlt.title: National Slate Museum
budgetAlt.description: Explore the history of the slate industry at this fascinating museum in Llanberis (free entry, donations welcome).

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Snowdonia weather is notoriously unpredictable. Be prepared for rain, even in summer. Check the forecast before you go and pack layers.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy, especially during peak season. Allow extra time for travel, especially around Betws-y-Coed and Llanberis. Parking at popular spots like Pen-y-Pass and Llanberis can fill up early.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Advance booking is essential for Zip World activities and highly recommended for Gorge Walking and White Water Rafting, especially during school holidays.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: This itinerary is designed to be relatively easy, but a reasonable level of fitness is required for gorge walking and walking up steep quarry paths.
